Source Package: keychain

summary: Key manager for OpenSSH

description: Keychain is an OpenSSH key manager, typically run from ~/.bash_profile. When keychain is run, it checks for a running ssh-agent, otherwise it starts one. It saves the ssh-agent environment variables to ~/.keychain/$HOSTNAME-sh, so that subsequent logins and non-interactive shells such as cron jobs can source the file and make passwordless ssh connections. In addition, when keychain runs, it verifies that the key files specified on the command-line are known to ssh-agent, otherwise it loads them, prompting you for a password if necessary

categories: Utils

install package(s): keychain

maintainer(s): Jari Aalto (Use the mailing list to report bugs or ask questions. Do not contact the maintainer(s) directly.)
